tool

Class Matrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • tool.Matrix

  • public class Matrix
extends java.lang.Object
    Proximity Matrix class. Representation of a matrix of size n>=1, where only the values above the main diagonal are stored and are different from 1.
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Jan-Michael Holzinger & Sophie Hofmanninger

        Constructor

    • Method Detail

      • setRef

        public void setRef(Element elem,
                   int position)
        This method defines the position of the element.
        Parameters:
        elem - The element, which should be specified to a position.
        position - The position of the element.

      • putRef

        public void putRef(Tuple<Element> elems,
                   float v)
            throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        This method puts a relation value between elements.
        Parameters:
        elems - This are the elements which should be related with a value.
        v - This is the relation value.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - Throws exception if element is not in the matrix.

      • putAt

        public void putAt(Tuple<java.lang.Integer> indices,
                  float v)
           throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException,
                  java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Put a value at a position in the upper triangle-part of the Matrix.
        Parameters:
        indices - The indices indicating the position
        v - the value to put.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if
        • the indices are negative,
        • exceed matrix size or
        • a position in the main diagonal or lower is accessed.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the value is not in [0,1].

      • getRef

        public float getRef(Tuple<Element> elems)
             throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        This method gets a relation value between elements.
        Parameters:
        elems - This are the elements where we want to know the relation value.
        Returns:
        This returns the relation value.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - Throws exception if element is not in the matrix.

      • getAt

        public float getAt(Tuple<java.lang.Integer> indices)
            throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Get a value from the Matrix.
        Parameters:
        indices - the position where the value is stored.
        Returns:
        the value at position (indices.getFirst(),indices.getSecond());
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if
        • the indices are negative or
        • exceed matrix size.

      • isPM

        public static boolean isPM(Matrix m)
        Determines if a given matrix fulfills the criterion to be a proximity matrix. I.e. all values stored must be in [0,1] and the values on the main diagonal must be 1.
        Parameters:
        m - The matrix to check.
        Returns:
        boolean true, iff the matrix fulfills the above mentioned criterion.

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns:
        the dimension of the Matrix.

      • getR

        public java.util.ArrayList<Element> getR(Element elem,
                                         float lambda)
        This method delivers the relations.
        Parameters:
        elem - This is the element from which we want the relatives.
        lambda - This is the lower bound of the relations.
        Returns:
        Returns a list of all relations.
